name: rss-feed-generator
title: RSS Feed Generator
description: Create RSS and Atom feeds from structured JSON data
content:
Overview

This application generates valid RSS 2.0 and Atom feeds from structured JSON data using the feedgen library. Perfect for creating podcast feeds, blog feeds, news feeds, and more.

Features

  • Generates both RSS 2.0 and Atom formats
  • Supports all standard RSS fields (title, link, description, etc.)
  • Automatic date parsing and formatting
  • Category and author support
  • Pretty-printed, readable XML output

JSON Input Format

Input should be a JSON array of items, or an object with feed metadata and an 'items' array:

{
  "title": "My Blog",
  "link": "https://myblog.com",
  "description": "Latest blog posts",
  "items": [
    {
      "title": "Post Title",
      "link": "https://myblog.com/post1",
      "description": "Post summary",
      "pubDate": "2025-01-15T10:00:00",
      "author": "John Doe",
      "category": ["Tech", "News"]
    }
  ]
}

Parameters

  • Input JSON File: Upload your structured feed data
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output
  • Feed Title, Link, Description: Basic feed metadata (can be in JSON or parameters)

Output

The application generates both feed.rss (RSS 2.0) and feed.atom (Atom) files.

Use Cases

  • Creating blog RSS feeds
  • Generating podcast feeds
  • News aggregation feeds
  • Content syndication
command: rm -rf prod_apps || true; git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git && python "$REPO_DIR/python/rss_feed_generator.py "${inputFile}" -o "${outputDir}" -n "${feedName}" -t "${feedTitle}" -l "${feedLink}" -d "${feedDescription}"
